reviews.review_msg: Derksen successfully referenced wizards during a lecture about First Nations poetry.
Interesting, intelligent, funny, and possibly the "nicest" professor ever. Very respectful of opinions contrary to his own and seems to care about every student in the class. Highly recommended.
Great discussions and really understanding. Makes dry material interesting and easier to read.
Very Understanding and creates great discussions for class

My biggest gripe outside of what everyone else has said, is that the assignment instructions were not only vague but contradictory. Why not just make what you want of us clear instead of writing your own essay? I have had not direct interaction with her but after watching some lectures and reading her write-ups/assignments, I never want to. Awful

Her lectures are useless, she gives a lot of work and didn't think carefully about the dates. Some people would be expected to be a week ahead for their discussions or else they would have to read a whole book in a day. Her instructions are vague and she says um every other word during lectures. The lectures are pretty cringe overall. Bad prof

She only set up the course and recorded lectures but I would say that both aren't great. The course has a heavy workload and the lectures, besides vague, are unbearable because she writes on a sheet of glass in front of her the whole time (so edgy) and it makes awful nails on a chalkboard sounds. The TA is nice but like most TAs, a tough marker

I took this class asynchronously. Sophie had far more assignments than my other English classes. Every week had a module with readings and a few paragraphs introducing it. She occasionally had 10 minute lectures posted, but they did not connect readings. This class is better suited for in-person or synchronous, than offline. The readings were good.
